projectSnapshot.businessType: Owner-operated native plant garden maintenance and installation

brandStory.tagline: Creating and maintaining habitat for wildlife
brandStory.elevatorPitch: I work with native plants installing and maintaining wildlife habitat. Conserving native landscapes for the future through specialized maintenance and butterfly garden installations.
brandStory.originStory: I began creating wildflower compositions for weddings and events in 2014 while foraging with Williams Wildflowers. From there, my love for native plants blossomed into long-term habitat stewardship, and I officially formed Tender Gardens LLC on June 14, 2024 to focus exclusively on Florida natives for homeowners who want thriving habitats.
differentiators: Exclusive use of Florida native plants - never non-natives or invasives
Deep expertise in butterfly and pollinator gardens
Maintenance-first approach for sustainable, low-input landscapes
Personal service from owner with 10+ years native plant experience
Education-focused, teaching clients about their gardens

segments.name: Eco-Conscious Homeowners
segments.description: 35-65 years old, college-educated, middle to upper-middle income residents who value environmental stewardship and want their landscapes to support local wildlife
segments.motivation: Make a positive environmental impact while creating beautiful, low-maintenance outdoor spaces

segments.name: Butterfly & Bird Enthusiasts
segments.description: Nature lovers who want to attract and support butterflies, native bees, and songbirds in their yards
segments.motivation: Create habitat and observe wildlife up close

segments.name: Frustrated Traditional Landscape Owners
segments.description: Homeowners tired of high-maintenance lawns, excessive water bills, and chemical inputs
segments.motivation: Reduce maintenance time and costs while having a more sustainable landscape

problemStatements: My traditional landscape requires too much water, chemicals, and constant maintenance
I want to support butterflies and pollinators but don't know which plants to use
I'm worried about invasive species taking over my native plantings
I can't tell which plants are native volunteers and which are weeds
I need someone who actually understands native plant care, not just lawn mowing
My yard looks boring and doesn't attract any wildlife
transformations: My garden now attracts butterflies, bees, and birds that I can watch and enjoy daily
I've reduced my water bill significantly and no longer use chemicals on my lawn
I've made a positive environmental impact through my landscape choices
My outdoor garden has become another 'room' on my property to enjoy
I feel confident that my landscape is supporting local ecosystems and wildlife
My neighbors ask me about my beautiful native plants and wildlife visitors

faqs.question: Do native plants really require less maintenance?
faqs.answer: Yes! Once established, native Florida plants are adapted to our climate and require significantly less water, no fertilizers, and minimal pest management. However, they do need regular weeding and monitoring, especially in the first year.

faqs.question: How long until my butterfly garden attracts butterflies?
faqs.answer: You may see butterflies within days of planting if you include nectar sources. For breeding butterflies, host plants need to be established and healthy - typically 3-6 months for consistent butterfly activity.

faqs.question: Will my native garden look messy or weedy?
faqs.answer: Native gardens have a natural, layered look that's different from formal landscapes. With proper maintenance and plant selection, they're beautiful year-round with seasonal interest. I help clients understand and appreciate the natural aesthetic.

faqs.question: What areas do you serve?
faqs.answer: I serve a 10-mile radius of my base location in Central Florida. This allows me to provide consistent, personalized service to each client.

faqs.question: Do you work on commercial properties?
faqs.answer: Currently I focus exclusively on residential properties and small residential-scale projects where I can provide personal attention and build long-term maintenance relationships.

clientExperience: Initial garden walk to assess property and discuss goals
Customized plan based on site conditions and client preferences
Professional installation with native plant sourcing
Education about plants and wildlife visitors throughout relationship

references: Natural, layered native plant gardens with seasonal interest
Butterflies on native flowers (monarchs on milkweed, swallowtails on pentas)
Close-ups of Florida native plants in bloom
Wildlife visitors: butterflies, native bees, hummingbirds, songbirds
Authentic photos of Central Florida native habitats
avoid: Non-native tropical plants or exotic species

serviceAreas: Focus on consistent service area for quality and efficiency

serviceDelivery.consultationBooking: By appointment, typically 1-week lead time for garden walks
serviceDelivery.installationTiming: Best in fall planting season (Sept-Nov) or spring (Mar-May)
serviceDelivery.capacity: Limited client base for excellent personal service

contactRequirements: Phone or email for initial inquiry
Site visit required before maintenance or installation quotes
Prefer clients within service radius for efficiency
